Home









 SSU receives $1.1 million to study wildfire effect's on CA forest health 
 This story was originally published by SSU News on January 19, 2022
By Nate Galvan | galvanna@sonoma.edu 
 Read More...  









The School of Science and Technology is a dynamic community committed to educational excellence across disciplines in the life and physical sciences, technology, engineering, math and health-related sciences including kinesiology and nursing. Our highly qualified and dedicated faculty and staff are committed to our mission to graduate learned and capable students that will contribute to the wellbeing and prosperity of our region, state, nation and planet.








School of Science & Technology

SST Home
About Us
Departments
Centers, Programs & Outreach
News & Events
College & Beyond
Student Resources
Faculty & Staff Resources
Support the School
Contact Us
























 





 


The funded research experiences I had at SSU were crucial in my finding a path in chemistry as a researcher. I had no idea what research really meant or what it would be like, but now it’s my present and hopefully future!





Paty De La Torre, Chemistry '18, UC Berkeley Graduate Student, First Generation Student



 
   





 


Faculty in Science & Technology really encouraged me out of my comfort zone and to go after much more than just my degree.





Dr. Austin Griffith, Biology '07, Local Dentist



 
   





 


The hands-on and distinguished projects within Science and Tech positively impacted not only my resume but also set me aside from other applicants when starting my career search.





Miah Crockett, Electrical Engineering '17, Intel Corporation



 
   





 


It is incredibly rewarding to work with and mentor science and technology students at SSU, their innovative programs prepare graduates to make an immediate impact.





Chris Stewart, President Pocket Radar, SSU Entrepreneur in Residence, Science & Technology Industry Partner and Mentor



 
   





 


Science and Tech helped open doors during my academic career through coursework and research opportunities [...] ranging from X-ray imaging to launching a small satellite into space.





Hunter Mills, Physics & Mathematics '13, Data Scientist at UCSF’s Bakar Computational Health Sciences

    Who Do I Contact?  







    Biology  




General Questions
biology@sonoma.edu


Advising Questions
Under 60 completed units?
Contact Christina Thao, Professional Academic Advisor
Schedule a virtual appointment with Christina through LoboConnect!
Completed 60 or more units?
General BA or BS: any advisor listed below
Ecology and Evolutionary Biology: Drs. Lisa Bentley, Daniel Crocker, Derek Girman, Brent Hughes, Nathan Rank, Richard Whitkus, or Mackenzie Zippay
Marine Biology: Drs. Daniel Crocker, Brent Hughes, Murali Pillai, Sean Place, or Mackenzie Zippay
Molecular Cell Biology: Drs. Michael Cohen, Lisa Hua, Joseph Lin, Murali Pillai, or Sean Place
Physiology: Drs. Daniel Crocker, Lisa Hua, Murali Pillai, Sean Place, or Mackenzie Zippay
Zoology: Drs. Daniel Crocker, Derek Girman, Brent Hughes, Sean Place, Nathan Rank, or Mackenzie Zippay
 





 






    Chemistry  




General Questions
chemdept@sonoma.edu


Advising Questions
Under 60 completed units?
Contact Christina Thao, Professional Academic Advisor
Schedule a virtual appointment with Christina through LoboConnect!
Completed 60 or more units?
For students with last names A - C: Dr. Monica Lares
For students with last names D - J: Dr. Bogdan Negru
For students with last names K - R: Dr. Steven Farmer
For students with last names S - Z: Dr. Mark Perri
 





 






    Computer Science  




General Questions
cs@sonoma.edu


Advising Questions
Under 60 completed units?
Contact Jami Grosser, Professional Academic Advisor
Schedule a virtual appointment with Jami through LoboConnect!
Completed 60 or more units?
Contact Drs. Mark Gondree, Ali Kooshesh, Nina Marhamati, Sabidur Rahman, B. Ravikumar, or Suzanne Rivoire. Your assigned advisor is shown in MySSU. If no advisor is listed for you, contact Dr. B. Ravikumar.
 





 






    Engineering Science  




General Questions
engineering@sonoma.edu


Advising Questions
Under 60 completed units?
Contact Jami Grosser, Professional Academic Advisor
Schedule a virtual appointment with Jami through LoboConnect!
Completed 60 or more units?
Contact Drs. Farid Farahmand, Mohamed Salem, Sudhir Shrestha, or Nansong Wu.
 





 






    Geology  




General Questions
geology@sonoma.edu


Advising Questions
Under 60 units completed?
Contact Christina Thao, Professional Academic Advisor
Schedule a virtual appointment with Christina through LoboConnect!
Completed 60 or more units?
Contact Dr. Matty Mookerjee
*If you are trying to get into a Geology course or have a question about a Geology course, please email the instructor of that course

General Questions

Exercise Science Concentration: Dr. Bulent Sokmen
Interdisciplinary/pre-OT Concentration: Dr. Ellen Carlton
Lifetime Physical Activity Concentration: Dr. YJ Ryuh
 





 






    Mathematics & Statistics  




General Questions

Under 60 units completed?

Schedule a virtual appointment with Christina through LoboConnect!

Bi-Di: Dr. Brigitte Lahme
Pure Math: Drs. Sam Brannen or Natalie Hobson
Secondary Teaching: Drs. Ben Ford or Martha Byrne
Statistics: Drs. Susan Herring, Elaine Newman, or Rodrigo Gaitan
 





 






    Nursing  




General Questions/Non-SSU Students
nursing@sonoma.edu


Advising Questions
Pre-Nursing: Jami Grosser or Dr. Anna Valdez
Schedule a virtual appointment with Jami through LoboConnect!
BSN: Drs. Rachel Napoli (class of 2023) or Karen Werder (class of 2022)

FNP: Dr. Jordan Rose or Melissa Sloan

    Not Sure Who to Contact?   


If you're not sure who to contact or you have a question about the School of Science and Technology, email technolo@sonoma.edu.
More advising information is available at SST Advising as well as SSU Advising Central.

    Public Lectures & Viewing Nights  


The School of Science & Technology is proud to offer a number of informative lecture series. Lecture series are held during the academic semesters and are open to all campus and community members. Information on individual lecture series is available via the following links.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 





Biology Colloquium
Chemistry Seminar
Computer Science Colloquium
Engineering Lecture Series
Geology Lecture Series
M*A*T*H Colloquium
Observatory Viewing Nights
What Physicists Do
